intro: Mosiera androsiana, commonly known as the Andros island morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Andros. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant produces heart-shaped leaves and has a climbing habit, often twining around other vegetation. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to coastal and sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
